alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 5:42PM CST until January 14 at 3:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, light snow and blowing snow leading to visibility reductions. Significant drifting in open areas. Total snow accumulations of a half inch or less. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Bureau and Putnam Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 AM CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous road conditions. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
